body.p: To the Rd Dr. Wise Edt Israelite

The following Art. appeared in your Paper on Tudy
1. April “Mr. Bruel on Talmud Yelodim institute) speaks thus
Mr. B in a lengthy Letter to the Occident notices the T Y I. thus
“The school under Dr. Wise is similarly circumstanced its annual
report show a dificiency of 7. to 800? but the members of his congregation
are very proud of their school. They attach to it a greater degree of
consequence than some might think it deserves hence they endeavor
to preserve its existance by private contributions and other sources,”“
would I have preferd answering your remarks to the above in
your own Paper but as you have denied me a hearing on 3 seperate occasions
though you profess to admit Articles of all kinds of persons in the
Israelite. I am reluctantly compelld to seek a hearing elsewhere,
reluctantly, because the public can have little interest in such
affairs„ The constant readers of yr. paper have satisfied themselves
that it invariably provokes dissention and when legitimatily
opposed, one is sure to be met with a torrent of abuse or a total deni
al is given the things it has provoked. these facts can be verified by the
Paper itself. You Sir, are not alone callous to ? the feelings of others, but
are also indifferent to your own standing as a journalist, it should be
your duty in accordance with your profession on the forthcoming of
the Israelite, to place both sides of public questions before the world
particularly matters pertaining to religion theology since justice
toward individual members of society, will reward the press, in the form
of increased confidence and respect in conclusion I may remark that
no public man should object to have his official conduct criticised
when the criticism manifests a desire to reveal truth and useful
information. I cannot conceive that the article now before
the public is in itsself of so flagrant a character as to cause such a
torrent of bitter recrimination, as you have bestowed on it, partic
ularly as you are aware I have only stated facts,, you commence
thus “One would scarcely think that fanaticism could thus mislead
an old man, as to speak slightly of an institute in which his own

Grand children receive their education and are counted among
the best of their age” In reply I have reason to say, that my
Grand children are as intelligent for their age as most children are,
It is because they can show so little for their prompt attendance
of nearly 3 years in a school that boasts, having preeminent adean
taps? that cannot be had in the U. S. or England nor elsewhere, it is
because they make no progress in things most essential at their
age, that I have repeatedly x to their parents, and if they are faithfull
to their children, and to themselves I trust they will soon perceive
that I have not complaned in vain, but sir in what I have said
I have not injured the reputation of the school, unless you consider
it Treason to speak the truth. I am not the only insidid individual
who think so its members attach more a greater degree of consequence
to their school than some might think it deserves. I can name
several if required, that will say the same, but sir their must be othr
causes which has so sorely displeased you, a side from the Article
in question. May it not be that you being aware of the members
mistaken attachment to their school, and as the Editor of an Hireling Press
have again prostituted your Ephemeral sheet to please your
supporters, you know you did in the like manner in the fall
Edition which greatly faciliatedtated to crush the cause you then
espoused. I spoke of the financial affairs of the school from its
annual report without coment. You continue that “The ortho
dox are enimies to instruction. They are therefore opposed to schools”
you boast, “That the school sends forth American Jews no Poles, no
Germans, no English, and no Irish, but Genuine self reflecting indipendant
American Jews, whom you cant trample whom you cannot
trample under the feet of Preists. This is all true and we can imma
gine your grief, your burning pain, your sacred woe, you should respect
this sacred plae? but your boundless fanaticism your unholy Zeal as
a partisan would not allow you to do justice to a place which is more
sacred than your Synagogue together with all your singing chanting
crying and jumping. Well Dr. Wise you certanly x must have

labord under some spiritual illusion, when you composed the foregoing
sentences, but can it be believed that the man who profess to defend
the Jew, and Judaism against every outside attack, will himself
address his coreligionists so wickedly spitefull, and for no other reason than
their misfortune to differ with him, and because an individual hath
said, “They attach a greater degree of consequence “Than some might think
it deserves„ Great man how contemptily have you fallen how differ
ently did Moses our faithful preceptor act, on a similar occasion.

“Because one man hath sind, wilt thou O Lord be indignant with an entire
community.” witness the language of a reformed Rabbi a teacher of Israel
the head and soul of a school, when the sacred pupils are trained to a
moral and religious course of education, that such a sacred place
under such a leader is more sacred than your Synagoge to gether with your
singing chanting crying and jumping„ shame Dr. Wise a person of your
cloth, to speak so insultingly to a god serving people, now can any
thing be more Priest trodden than this.„ let me tell you Dr. Wise
there is not a jewish congregation on this or the old continent, that
is so Priestly imposed under fair pretences, as your congregation are
witness their reception of your new Minag (liturgy) which they
accepted by acclamation in its printed form, they having full
confidence in all things you write or preach while it is rejected
by every congregation in the union excepting a miserable few.
Thus you revised a prayer Book, and have stricken out passages
& prayers, the best to fortify Israelites in a belief in god, as a benevolent
rewarder of the good, and the strict judge of sin, the belief in the life of
the spirit after death, and the eternal permanence of Israel as
gods people, as also in the restoration of the Temple of the Lord now
in ruins and of our state, which is now no more, yes in order to
deprive your congregation of this belief, were all those prayer
which refer to it Banished and the remainder so mutilated, and
discoverable only to the initiated, and to make room for such a po
patch work„ you have caused them to reject a prayer book com
posed by Israels heroes, by the most famed teachers, whose spirit
so

survives to this day among us, as the ornament and glory of Israel whose
names will never be blotted out b y time, but which one age hands down to
the other by men who did not degrade science into an instrument for the
ir own advancement or employed as a mere means of getting bread. I will
spare you the pain of naming your associate authors, in the work of yr.
new liturgy enough to say they are all worthy of each other. You conclude that
“Mr Bruel boasts that his orthodox congregation are free of debt!!!
“This is because they do not pay their Hazonam (Readers) enoug to make
a living, because they have no synagogue of their own, because they care
not for the poor, they pay not a cent for education excepting a few only
they pay not a cent to our Hospital nor to our relief society nor to
any charitable institute ton purpose, therefore there Synagogue are
free of debt. Open your ears Dr. Wise and I will tell you truths, things
indeed out of your line. Know then that our small congregation
pay our chazan (reader) an amt of salary fully equal to that which your
synagog or any other in this city are paying, we have a Synagogue &
furniture of our own on a lease, a Cemetry for our dead real estate
paid for, our congregation synagogue pay as much to the Hospital
and relief fund as yours do. The Hospital originated with the orthodox while
the releif society grew out of a benevolent Institution, in a word, you have placed a
false constriction on the whole, because all the charitable institutions you have
enumerated are supported entirely by voluntary subscription, and all of them were in existance
before you came here, nor do any of the synagogues here pay one cent to them from their
respective treasury, therefore we pay as much as you do every family obtain private
Hebrew teachers for their children, they need not support your schools if they disa
prove of its chief head. They avail themselves of our districts schools believing they
are better than yours. What benifit have for taunting a religious institution
for being cold and indifferent to the wants of their needy correligionists when you
know to the contrary. If I have said any thing offencively concerning their school
I can assure its leaders that none was intended, and none but a persons having the
principles of Dr. Wise principles, who constantly is striving to sow the seed of contention
would have made so much from so small an affair S Bruel ND „The Occident is
now a weekly paper every Israelite should read that old established sheet, whose uniform course have
obtained for itself a reputation for ability, truthfulness, and consistancy, it is a faithful and reliable
Jurnal whose views and principles remain unchanged by reading the weekly Occidn.
